title: Breakaway
description: Breakaway is the second studio album by American pop singer Kelly Clarkson, released on November 30, 2004, in Canada and in the United States, by RCA Records, with a wider release following throughout 2005. Despite the commercial success of Clarkson's debut album Thankful (2003), music critics still continued to typecast her as an American Idol gagnant and were also critical of her attempts of establishing a commercial appeal on her own. Wanting to stray from those, she collaborated with a range of new songwriters and producers such as Dr. Luke, Max Martin, John Shanks, Kara DioGuardi, and with former Evanescence members Ben Moody and David Hodges. This overhaul also led her to part ways with her manager Simon Fuller and hire the management services of Jeff Kwatinetz before the album's release.

title: Stronger
description: 2011 release, the fifth album from the international Pop icon and winner of the first ever American Idol. The vibrant, musically diverse Stronger (which Clarkson says was influenced by Tina Turner, Prince, Sheryl Crow, and Radiohead) will thrill those who love Clarkson for her resilience. Clarkson co-wrote five tracks on Stronger, a process she feels is therapeutic and the first single off the new album is "Mr. Know It All". Kelly Clarkson has sold over 20 million albums worldwide (including 10 million in the U.S.) and notching seven singles on the Top 10 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart.

title: Pride & Prejudice (Music From The Motion Picture)
description:
Pride & Prejudice (Music from the Motion Picture) is the soundtrack to the 2005 film of the same name and was composed by Dario Marianelli and performed by Jean-Yves Thibaudet (piano) and the English Chamber Orchestra. The movie Pride & Prejudice is a screen adaptation of the 1813 novel Pride and Prejudice by Jane Austen.

Marianelli received an Oscar nomination for Best Achievement in Music Written for Motion Pictures, Original Score and two World Soundtrack Academy nominations.

"A Postcard To Henry Purcell" is based on a theme from Henry Purcell's incidental music for Abdelazar, that was also used by Benjamin Britten in The Young Person's Guide to the Orchestra.

localized_title.text: Pride & Prejudice (Music From The Motion Picture)

localized_description.text:
《傲慢与偏见》是英国小说史上最著名的作品之一，其作品的魅力一直延续至今。英国的一家机构调查发现，在现代英国女性的眼中的头牌约会对象竟然还是18世纪的《傲慢与偏见》男主人公达西(Darcy)。而最近英国BBC4台（BBC Radio4）在读者中的一项调查再度验证了这一结果：在票选出对女性影响最大、曾改变女性世界观的文学作品中《傲慢与偏见》又列榜首。
这部小说曾经数次被搬进屏幕。最新的电影版是2005年所拍，其音乐只能用美不胜收来形容。
达里奥·马利安那利（Dario Marianelli）的这个名字实在是很陌生，其实他刚刚以《格林兄弟》（The Brothers Grimm）的配乐让好莱坞配乐界留下深刻印象，乐评家对他也很捧场，Music from the Movies给了他五颗星的最高荣誉。
紧接着这部由简·奥斯汀改编的经典名著，这个意大利作曲家继续以古典与浪漫兼具的曲风又一次赢得乐评的赞扬，宛如英国典雅派教主帕特里克·多叶（Patrick Doyle）风格，点缀以浪漫极微主义作品，《傲慢与偏见》的音乐只能用美不胜收来形容。
初听这张原声大碟，“如沐春风”是唯一的感想。由法国钢琴家Jean-Yves Thibaudet担任所有的钢琴演奏，让原声中的钢琴质感一流，加上英国室内管弦乐团的协奏，可看出制片与导演对配乐的重视程度。
达里奥·马利安那利自己说，导演希望作曲家写出一段钢琴独奏，让主角在影片中演奏，导演拿贝多芬的早期奏鸣曲让他参考，希望他仿作出简·奥斯汀那个年代的人可能听到的音乐，因此早在电影开拍前，达里奥就参与了作曲的工作，第一首“Dawn”与“Georgiana”就是在开拍前写就，其中“Dawn”更成为女主角伊丽莎白的主题，在音乐发展中不断被用到。而“Liz On Top Of The World”与“Your Hands Are Cold”则展现了如《钢琴课》中浪漫激越的旋律，与仿古典奏鸣曲之作形成有力的对比，让听众很容易区分出音乐扮演的角色，更有趣的是，在影片中由主角所演奏的“有源音乐”（如“Dawn”）却在浪漫旋律中穿进穿出，背景配乐与“有源音乐”水乳交融，声气一致，整张原声带的可听性大为提高。　　“凡是有钱的单身汉，总想娶位太太，这已经成了一条举世公认的真理。这样的单身汉，每逢新搬到一个地方，四邻八舍虽然完全不了解他的性情如何，见解如何，可是，既然这样的一条真理早已在人们心目中根深蒂固，因此人们总是把他看作自己某一个女儿理所应得的一笔财产。”
这是英国著名女作家简·奥斯汀的代表作《傲慢与偏见》的开篇一段话，引出了一段发生在十九世纪初英国的关于爱与价值的经典故事。
众所周知，奥斯汀在这部小说中通过班纳特五个女儿对待终身大事的不同处理，表现出乡镇中产阶级家庭出身的少女对婚姻爱情问题的不同态度，从而也反映了作者本人对爱情对婚姻的想法：单单为了财产、金钱和地位而结婚是错误的；而结婚不考虑上述因素也是愚蠢的。因此，她既反对以金钱为目的的结婚，也反对把婚姻当儿戏。她强调理想婚姻的重要性，并把男女双方感情作为缔结理想婚姻的基石。
故事的女主人公伊丽莎白·班纳特(凯拉·奈特丽)出身于小地主家庭有四个姐妹，姐姐简·班纳特、妹妹玛丽·班纳特、凯蒂·班纳特和莱蒂娅·班纳特。姐妹五人单调且略显平静的生活伴随着两个年轻小伙子的到来而泛起无可平灭的波澜。健康向上的宾格里和富家子达西(马修·麦克法登)是一对要好的朋友，在结识了镇上班纳特家的这“五朵金花”之后，一段美丽而饱含“傲慢与偏见”的爱情故事……
故事发生在18世纪末充满等级观念的英国，生活在英国乡村的班纳特家五姐妹，伊丽莎白(姬拉?耐特丽 饰)、简、琳迪(吉娜?马龙 饰)、玛莉、凯蒂都已经长大成人，母亲盘算着快点为她们找到理想老公，而备受父亲疼爱的二女儿伊丽莎白却只想保持现在的独立生活。每个小镇上刚搬来的年轻单身汉都会被母亲看作是自己某个女儿应得的财产，富有的彬格莱(西蒙?伍茨 饰)先生就是她最新的一个目标。在一次舞会上，班纳特夫人将自己的女儿介绍给彬格莱及他的朋友达西先生(马休?麦克菲迪恩 饰)，但伊丽莎白无意中听到达西对当地社交界的蔑视，从而对他产生偏见。
此时伊丽莎白的远房表兄造访，并轻浮地向她求婚，被伊丽莎白断然拒绝，彬格莱的妹妹渐渐被达西吸引，于是开始不断挑拨和拨坏伊丽莎白与他的关系，而达西的一位朋友，虚伪狡诈的年轻军官韦翰也不断捏造达西的坏话，一段爱情逐渐开始遭受到傲慢与偏见的严峻挑战…… 这位富豪子弟达西在短暂的交往中深深地爱上了美丽的伊丽莎白。并且，达西不顾门第和财富的差距，勇敢地向她求婚，却遭到无情的拒绝。伊丽莎白对他的误会和偏见是有一定原因的，因为出身富贵的达西经常表现出不可一世的傲慢，这令正直善良的伊丽莎白讨厌不已。因为达西的这种傲慢实际上是地位差异的反映，只要存在这种傲慢，他与伊丽莎白之间就不可能有共同的思想感情，也不可能有理想的婚姻。但经过了一段时间之后，渐渐地，伊丽莎白发现并亲眼看到了同样善良的达西的为人处世和一系列所作所为有了质的改变。特别是看到他改变了过去那种骄傲自负的神态，从而，伊丽莎白对他的误会和偏见也逐渐消失，一段美满的姻缘也就此最终成就。姐妹们也各自得到了想要的甜蜜生活…… 幕后花絮:
《傲慢与偏见》是奥斯汀的代表作。这部作品以日常生活为素材，一反当时社会上流行的感伤小说的内容和矫揉造作的写作方法，生动地反映了18世纪末到19世纪初处于保守和闭塞状态下的英国乡镇生活和世态人情。这部社会风情画式的小说不仅在当时吸引着广大的读者，时至今日，仍给读者以独特的艺术享受。而且至今，根据这部名著改编的电影电视作品也不下十几部不过其间佳作甚少。或许，只有1948年版本的《傲慢与偏见》算是能给我们留下些许的印象，影片在各方面都称得上有不错的表现，而且在电影之外还有脍炙人口的音乐得以流传。
从小说原著中看，伊丽莎白聪敏机智、有胆识、有远见，且具有很强的自尊心，并善于思考问题。就当时一个算得上大户闺中的小姐来讲，这是非常难能可贵的。正是由于这种品质，才使她在爱情问题上有独立的主见，并导致她与达西经过了百般的周折之后，组成美满的家庭。另外，在故事中，作者还描写了伊丽莎白的几个姐妹和女友的婚事，这些都是陪衬，用来与女主人公理想的婚姻相对照。例如夏洛蒂和柯林斯尽管婚后过着舒适的物质生活，但他们之间没有爱情，这种婚姻实际上是掩盖在华丽外衣下的社会悲剧…… 影片基本上尊重原著，同样通过对人物性格语言等细微处的着重描写，突出反应出伊丽莎白对达西先后几次求婚的不同态度，实际上反映了女性对人格独立和平等权利的追求。这也是伊丽莎白这一人物形象在当时社会大背景下的进步意义。

title: Somewhere in time, I love you
description:
若你遇见了爱，
如人们口中的，
我想知道，
那是什么样子。
— 告五人 《我肯定在几百年前就说过爱你》
告五人首张专辑《我肯定在几百年前就说过爱你》探讨爱的本质，描写关于爱的不同切面，从生活经验里，写下关于爱的蛛丝马迹。什么是爱呢？其实我们也无法真正回答爱是什么，仍常在爱里迷失，但也在边迷路边寻找答案的过程，沿途找到散落在各地的自己。

title: Ash Like Snow
description:
"Ash Like Snow" is the 17th single from the Japanese rock band the Brilliant Green.

This song serves as the second opening theme for the Japanese anime, Mobile Suit Gundam 00. The first press contains a Gundam 00 sticker, which differs between limited edition and regular edition, along with Allelujah Haptism's character ID card. The song's music video also made several references to Gundam 00 such as the appearance of Lockon's Haro and Tomoko dressed as Wang Liu Mei. The song was released coincidentally with the band's singer's birthday.

title: The Rise and Fall of Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders From Mars
description:
The Rise and Fall of Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders from Mars (often shortened to Ziggy Stardust) is the fifth studio album by the English musician David Bowie, released on 16 June 1972 in the United Kingdom through RCA Records. It was co-produced by Bowie and Ken Scott and features Bowie's backing band the Spiders from Mars, composed of Mick Ronson (guitar), Trevor Bolder (bass) and Mick Woodmansey (drums). It was recorded from November 1971 to February 1972 at Trident Studios in London.

Described as a loose concept album and rock opera, Ziggy Stardust focuses on Bowie's titular alter ego Ziggy Stardust, a fictional androgynous and bisexual rock star who is sent to Earth as a saviour before an impending apocalyptic disaster. In the story, Ziggy wins the hearts of fans but suffers a fall from grace after succumbing to his own ego. The character was inspired by numerous musicians, including Vince Taylor. Most of the album's concept was developed after the songs were recorded. The glam rock and proto-punk musical styles were influenced by Iggy Pop, The Velvet Underground and Marc Bolan. The lyrics explore the artificiality of rock music, political issues, drug use, sexuality and stardom. The album cover, photographed in monochrome and recoloured, was taken in London outside the home of furriers "K. West".

公元1972年，离世界毁灭还有五年时间。来自火星、一头红发、性别模糊的摇滚巨星用他眩目的衣服、高跟鞋和闪光眼影，还有最激动人心的音乐，拯救了千千万万绝望中的少男少女们。三十多年过去了，Ziggy已死，Bowie还活着，而1972年的传奇将永远不朽。

Most of the album's concept was developed after the songs were recorded. The glam rock and proto-punk musical styles were influenced by Iggy Pop, The Velvet Underground and Marc Bolan. The lyrics explore the artificiality of rock music, political issues, drug use, sexuality and stardom. The album cover, photographed in monochrome and recoloured, was taken in London outside the home of furriers "K. West".

title: K.I.D.S.
description: K.I.D.S. (backronym for Kickin' Incredibly Dope Shit) is the fourth mixtape by American rapper Mac Miller. It was released by Rostrum Records on August 13, 2010, through DatPiff. The title is a reference to the 1995 drama film Kids, which is quoted throughout the mixtape. It was later commercially released on April 29, 2020. A deluxe version was released on its 10th anniversary and includes two new tracks, "Ayye" and "Back In The Day".

title: Mirages
description: The follow-up to 2003's critically acclaimed Radio Amor, Mirages further erodes the vapid predispositions of electronic music,  uncovering a terrain where dissonance and melody coincide in a  near-bohemian unison.

title: She's So Unusual
description: One of the great new wave/early MTV records, She's So Unusual is a giddy mix of self-confidence, effervescent popcraft, unabashed sentimentality, subversiveness, and clever humor. In short, it's a multifaceted portrait of a multifaceted talent, an artist that's far more clever than her thin, deliberately girly voice would indicate. Then again, Lauper's voice suits her musical persona, since its chirpiness adds depth, or reconfigures the songs, whether it's the call to arms of &Girls Just Want to Have Fun& or the tearjerking &Time After Time.& Lauper is at her very best on the first side, all of which were singles or received airplay, and this collection of songs -- &Money Changes Everything,& &Girls,& &When You Were Mine,& &Time,& &She Bop,& &All Through the Night& -- is astonishing in its consistency, so strong that it makes the remaining tracks -- all enjoyable, but rather pedestrian -- charming by their association with songs so brilliantly alive. If Lauper couldn't maintain this level of consistency, it's because this captured her persona better than anyone could imagine -- when a debut captures a personality so well, let alone a personality so tied to its time, the successive work can't help but pale in comparison. Still, when it's captured as brightly and brilliantly as it is here, it does result in a debut that retains its potency, long after its production seems a little dated.

title: 我們就像那些要命的傻瓜
description: On their fourth album, The Dreamers—whose Chinese name is the rather more indecent “We’re just like those damn fools”—indie-rock band Accusefive consider questions of maturity, direction and destiny. And to match the scope of those big ideas, the trio hit the road themselves, leaving Taiwan to record at London’s famed Abbey Road Studios. There, Tsai Hsin-lun (vocals), Pan Yun-an (vocals/guitar) and Richard Lin (drums) opted to break with their usual practice of treating recording and mixing as separate stages and capture as complete a sound as possible in the studio—while aiming to retain the core soul of their original demos. The result is a set of ambitious yet vulnerable tracks fuelled by the experience of the journey, from fruitful collaborations to the studio’s collection of historic equipment. Below, the members of Accusefive share with Apple Music how they rose to the challenge of realising the record they had in mind. How did recording in London and self-producing affect your creative process? Tsai Hsin-lun: “We saw different results. Cultural differences aside, different settings have their own rules. We weren’t in Asia; we were in an unfamiliar environment. Self-producing this album and integrating a place that wasn’t ours was a way for us to try something new. This will remain in our memories as a special chapter in our lives.” Lin: “I feel like it’s an important nutrient. Accusefive tries new things each and every year, so it’s a new experience not just for the three of us but for the entire team.” What’s your process for achieving the Accusefive sound? Tsai: “The best way to describe Accusative’s sound quality is ‘direct’. We like using a direct approach and directly expressing emotions in our demos, but our choice of words, arrangements and harmonies bring out different feelings. Working from these demos, we chose to use a subtractive process for our songs. This gives them all a broad sense of direction, but we’re actually very particular when we perform them to make sure all the emotional ingredients are under control. So the album is both direct and exacting.” Richard Lin: “Subtractive thinking means having a definite picture of the timbre in your mind. You need that picture to be very clear before you record. The thing that’s hard is how to express it. Everyone’s subtractive process is different, so we’re always trying out different things and talking about adjusting the details to mould the shape of the sound so that it goes in the direction we want. “We worked with Shojiro Watanabe as recording and mixing engineer, so our process this time was to decide on the direction of the sound first, before doing any recording. It was challenging for us because we hadn’t done anything like it before.” How would you characterise the album as a whole? Pan Yun-an: “Our fourth album is a summation of my personal experiences and my outlook on life. It has a little of the feeling of a tearful recollection. So many things have happened along the way—I thought for ages about whether I ought to write them into song. Of course, ultimately I did decide to—and to head forward along our chosen path. “To us, listening to an album involves lots and lots of layers—like waves in the ocean or the elevations while climbing a mountain—each with a different aesthetic. The layers we’ve chosen this time are more like waves.” “The opening three songs are on the heavier side. But by ‘Beyond The Sea’, it’s like turning a page to a different scene to plunge straight into the ocean depths, where you find ’Threads Of Me’. Then it’s an upward road through ‘Forget For Get’, ‘Happy Bomb!!’, ‘Broken Wings’, ‘True Colors - Dreamers’ and ‘You & Me’ to the high point of ‘Run, Run, Run!’. I love this track order, which make the album sound like wave upon wave.” Below, Accusefive share insights into selected album tracks “Run, Run, Run!” Pan: “This is an especially important song for us and one that made us teary in the studio. It’s a song that breaks your heart every time. It sums up myself and my life since becoming part of Accusefive. I’m eager to share this feeling—and I hope this song can be there for any fan that needs it.” “Turn Wrong To Right” Pan: “This song describes a fateful choice. My favourite lyrics are 'You and I had hardships in the past/But after all those ordeals we no longer beat ourselves up/Let wrongs be wrongs and love be love/Make the best of it and face the future no matter what comes.’ For me, that passage is an explanation of the entire album. We can choose to remember the happy things and forget the painful ones, to find ways to change and reflect instead of wallowing in pain. It’s a way to cheer myself up, and to say to my past self, ‘Hey, let’s try to make the loneliness go away.’” “Happy Bomb!!” Pan: “We had a great time working with Masa and Stone of Mayday. This one echoes the other tracks in saying that moments of happiness shouldn’t be forgotten—they ought to be remembered. I wrote this song with my older brother Pan Yanshan, who’s a lively and fascinating writer. He did the verses and I did the chorus.” “Threads Of Me” Pan: “This song was revised more than any other on the album. We held lots of meetings and even got into arguments while discussing the arrangement—all because it’s an important song. We were trying to decide what style to use to interpret it and what part it should play on the album. We ultimately found it a place as the album’s lightest yet most serious song. On first hearing, it’s a song of reconciliation, a feeling of a wound that’s healed. But that’s not actually the case. The song asks the question, ‘What should we do with a wound that will never heal?’ Whether the wound gets gradually better or worse is all up to the choices we make.” “You & Me” Tsai: “This song is a pure expression of emotion. One line in it, ‘My memories make mischief by bringing you before me, at every point measuring my misunderstanding of you,” tells of two people who get together despite knowing they’re incompatible. They think that proximity might be enough to wear away each other’s spikes and let them coexist comfortably. But the spikes grow back—they’re a natural part of them. Is it a good thing to be forever trying to change the purest form of our other half? Maybe we shouldn’t have been together in the first place. We did, though—and it’s a beautiful, painful process. For me, this song is incredibly meaningful.” “Broken Wings” Lin: “Pan used a Leslie speaker for the guitar on this one—we never used one before. It has an effect that makes the sound seem to sway in the air, so listening to it feels a little unreal. We found some wonderful surprises from the old equipment we came across while recording at Abbey Road Studios that further spurred our drive to make better music. “The percussion setup on this track is simple, a pairing of new drums and old ones. The old cymbals were pretty tarnished with a unique sound compared to newer cymbals. Recording that setup was a wonderful thing.”

localized_description.text: 告五人第四张专辑《我们就像那些要命的傻瓜》，是一次抛开安全感的音乐冒险——乐队首次全程担任专辑制作人，在艾比路录音室（位于伦敦的全球知名录音室）迎接跨文化挑战，交出 12 首直面成长试炼的作品。告五人邀请日籍混音师渡边省二郎深度参与录音过程，金曲阵容如陈君豪、柯智豪、黄中岳、韩立康等亦贡献力量，五月天石头、玛莎更惊喜现身，参与《快乐的事记不起》的英伦 City-Pop 合奏。 专辑名中“要命的傻瓜”，是对那份敢于自省、不惧试炼的傻劲的礼赞，它献给在实践梦想路上，同样怀抱勇气、有点傻却充满爱的灵魂。《城市之丘》以战火硝烟般的编曲宣告主题，随后经历《有太多不能讲》的戏剧张力、《将错就对》的命运叩问，到《从未见过的海》轻盈翻页。告别过度修饰，《黑画面之旅》同步录音，捕捉了他们最赤诚、放松的互动瞬间。以下，告五人的三位成员与 Apple Music 分享了这次专辑制作的特别体验，并推荐出他们心中最喜爱的歌曲。 这是你们首次担任专辑制作人，在艾比路录音室中经历了文化与制作方式的碰撞，这段制作旅程有什么不同的收获？ 犬青：“不同的收获，除了文化差异之外，还有不同的职场规则，也和亚洲不一样。在一个我们不熟悉的环境里面，去制作这张专辑，融入在一个原本不属于自己的地方，对我们来说都是新的尝试，所以这段回忆在我们的人生中是一个非常特别的篇章。” 哲谦：“我觉得是一个非常重要的养分，告五人每一年每一年都在尝试新的东西，除了我们三个之外，对于整个团队来说也都是新的体验。” 专辑选择使用“减法思考”，试图通过精炼的方式保留 demo 中的核心元素。在取舍之间，最能代表告五人的声音特质是什么呢？ 云安：“最能代表告五人的声音特质，我觉得是‘直接’，demo 里的告五人本来就很喜欢用直接的方式、直接的情感去表达一件事情，但是我们会用文字、编曲还有我们选择的和弦，去让它有不同的感觉。” 哲谦：“减法思考要先确定你想象的音色是什么画面，要录制前，那个画面在脑袋里面是需要很清楚的。这次和我们合作的渡边老师，身兼录音师跟混音师。这次的录制方式是所有声音方向都确定了才开始进行录制，这也是我们在面对新的挑战时，一个很重要的难题。” 接下来，请成员们各自推荐几首最喜欢的歌曲，分享你们的感触。 云安：“第四张专辑，综合了我自己的人生观及亲身体验发生的事情，比较像是回忆血泪的感觉。我们觉得一张专辑听下来一定要非常非常有层次感，无论是波浪一样的层次或像爬山一样的层次，都有不同的美感，而我们这次选择的比较像波浪的层次感。 “开场的三首歌，听起来比较重一点，一直到《从未见过的海》，像翻书一样翻页，翻页到另外一个画面，直奔下坠到海浪最深层，就是《愈合》这首歌。再一路一路从《依着光》《快乐的事记不起》《鹰》《我天生》到《夏天的海冬天的雪》，最后到《黑夜狂奔》达到高点。我们非常非常喜欢这次的歌序，希望这样的安排，让整张专辑听起来像海浪一样的层次。” 《将错就对》 云安：“这首歌讲述的是‘命运的选择’，我最喜欢里面有一段歌词是‘上辈子你我都经历磨难/死去的活来的我们都不再为难/错就错/爱就爱/将错就对/不管未来该怎么去承担’。这段歌词是我对这首歌跟整张专辑的解释之一，我们可以选择去记得快乐的事情，忘掉痛苦的事情，想办法改变、反省，而不是一直沉溺在痛苦里。我想要给自己打气，也想要跟上辈子的自己说：‘嗯，这辈子我们试试看，我们试着让孤寂消散。’” 《愈合》 云安：“是整张专辑里修改最多次的一首歌，我们开了非常多次会，甚至在讨论编曲时产生了一点小争吵。因为这首歌对我们来讲很重要，大家在抉择到底要用什么样的乐曲跟乐风去诠释这首歌，要让这首歌在这张专辑里面呈现一个什么样的存在？最后我们让这首歌成为这张专辑里最轻但听起来最沉重的存在。《愈合》这首歌，乍听之下是和好，伤口已经好了的感觉，但其实不是，这首歌想讲的是‘面对一个永远不会好的伤口，我们应该怎么办？’要让伤口一步一步变好或变坏，就在于我们怎么选择。” 《快乐的事记不起》 云安：“我们跟玛莎哥和石头哥一起玩得非常非常愉快，这首歌也呼应了其他歌曲——快乐的事不应该记不起，快乐的事其实应该要记得。而这首歌也是我跟我哥哥潘燕山一起写的词，他写得非常生动有趣，主歌由他负责，副歌由我负责，一起完成了这首歌曲。” 《鹰》 哲谦：“云安在弹这首歌的吉他时，用的是一个 Leslie 的音箱，这个音箱我们之前从来没见过，它会有一个效果，让声音在空间中呈现出像是摆动（的效果），当时听到这个声音，有一种很不真实的感觉。我们在艾比路录音室录音时，这些年代很久的器材给我们带来了惊喜，让我们想要把音乐做得更好。这首歌的鼓组结构很简单，我把新的鼓跟旧的鼓合并，加上我自己带的铜钹，那些铜钹都是已经锈蚀到一定程度，音色相较于新的铜钹是很独特的，可以把这个东西记录下来，非常美好。” 《夏天的海冬天的雪》 犬青：“这是一首很纯粹讲述感情的歌曲，里面有一句歌词’是我的回忆在作祟/把你带到我的面前/处处丈量对你的不理解’，讲出了两个非常清楚彼此不适合的人，试着在一起，想着也许可以互相磨合对方身上的刺，让彼此在一起是舒服的，但殊不知那些刺还是会长出来，其实那就是各自原本的样子，但我们一直在试着改变另一半最纯粹的样子，是好，还是不好？或许一开始就不应该在一起，但我们尝试了，而这是一个美好又痛苦的过程。这首歌对我来说，是很深刻的一首歌。” 《黑夜狂奔》 云安：“这首歌对于我们来说非常非常重要，也是一首我们在录音室录到鼻酸，每一次听也会觉得揪心的歌曲。这首歌综合了我自己及我成为告五人之后的人生体验，很想和大家分享这个感觉，也希望用这首歌陪伴任何需要的歌迷朋友们。”

This one echoes the other tracks in saying that moments of happiness shouldn’t be forgotten—they ought to be remembered. I wrote this song with my older brother Pan Yanshan, who’s a lively and fascinating writer. He did the verses and I did the chorus.” “Threads Of Me” Pan: “This song was revised more than any other on the album. We held lots of meetings and even got into arguments while discussing the arrangement—all because it’s an important song. We were trying to decide what style to use to interpret it and what part it should play on the album. We ultimately found it a place as the album’s lightest yet most serious song. On first hearing, it’s a song of reconciliation, a feeling of a wound that’s healed. But that’s not actually the case. The song asks the question, ‘What should we do with a wound that will never heal?’ Whether the wound gets gradually better or worse is all up to the choices we make.” “You & Me” Tsai: “This song is a pure expression of emotion. One line in it, ‘My memories make mischief by bringing you before me, at every point measuring my misunderstanding of you,” tells of two people who get together despite knowing they’re incompatible. They think that proximity might be enough to wear away each other’s spikes and let them coexist comfortably. But the spikes grow back—they’re a natural part of them. Is it a good thing to be forever trying to change the purest form of our other half? Maybe we shouldn’t have been together in the first place. We did, though—and it’s a beautiful, painful process. For me, this song is incredibly meaningful.” “Broken Wings” Lin: “Pan used a Leslie speaker for the guitar on this one—we never used one before. It has an effect that makes the sound seem to sway in the air, so listening to it feels a little unreal. We found some wonderful surprises from the old equipment we came across while recording at Abbey Road Studios that further spurred our drive to make better music. “The percussion setup on this track is simple, a pairing of new drums and old ones. The old cymbals were pretty tarnished with a unique sound compared to newer cymbals. Recording that setup was a wonderful thing.”

On their fourth album, The Dreamers—whose Chinese name is the rather more indecent “We’re just like those damn fools”—indie-rock band Accusefive consider questions of maturity, direction and destiny. To match the scope of those big ideas, the trio hit the road, leaving Taiwan to record at London’s famed Abbey Road Studios. There, Tsai Hsin-lun (vocals), Pan Yun-an (vocals/guitar) and Richard Lin (drums) opted to break with their usual practice of treating recording and mixing as separate stages and capture as complete a sound as possible in the studio—while aiming to retain the core soul of their original demos. “Cultural differences aside, different settings have their own rules. We weren’t in Asia; we were in an unfamiliar environment,” says Tsai of the experience. “Self-producing this album and integrating a place that wasn’t ours was a way for us to try something new. This will remain in our memories as a special chapter in our lives.” The result is a set of ambitious yet vulnerable tracks fuelled by the experience of the journey, from fruitful collaborations to the studio’s collection of historic equipment. “Our fourth album is a summation of my personal experiences and my outlook on life,” says Pan. “It has a little of the feeling of a tearful recollection. So many things have happened along the way—I thought for ages about whether I ought to write them into song. Of course, ultimately I did decide to—and to head forward along our chosen path.” “You need that picture to be very clear before you record,” says Lin. “The thing that’s hard is how to express it. We’re always trying out different things and talking about adjusting the details to mould the shape of the sound so that it goes in the direction we want.” Below, Accusefive share their insights into selected album tracks. “Turn Wrong To Right” Pan: “This song describes a fateful choice. My favourite lyrics are 'You and I had hardships in the past/But after all those ordeals we no longer beat ourselves up/Let wrongs be wrongs and love be love/Make the best of it and face the future no matter what comes.’ For me, that passage is an explanation of the entire album. We can choose to remember the happy things and forget the painful ones, to find ways to change and reflect instead of wallowing in pain. It’s a way to cheer myself up, and to say to my past self, ‘Hey, let’s try to make the loneliness go away.’” “Beyond The Sea” “The opening three songs are on the heavier side. But by ‘Beyond The Sea’, it’s like turning a page to a different scene to plunge straight into the ocean depths, where you find ‘Threads Of Me’. Then it’s an upward road through ‘Forget For Get’, ‘Happy Bomb!!’, ‘Broken Wings’, ‘True Colors - Dreamers’ and ‘You & Me’ to the high point of ‘Run, Run, Run!’. I love this track order, which make the album sound like wave upon wave.” “Happy Bomb!!” Pan: “We had a great time working with Masa and Stone of Mayday. This one echoes the other tracks in saying that moments of happiness shouldn’t be forgotten—they ought to be remembered. I wrote this song with my older brother Pan Yanshan, who’s a lively and fascinating writer. He did the verses and I did the chorus.” “Threads Of Me” Pan: “This song was revised more than any other on the album. We held lots of meetings and even got into arguments while discussing the arrangement—all because it’s an important song. We were trying to decide what style to use to interpret it and what part it should play on the album. We ultimately found it a place as the album’s lightest yet most serious song. On first hearing, it’s a song of reconciliation, a feeling of a wound that’s healed. But that’s not actually the case. The song asks the question, ‘What should we do with a wound that will never heal?’ Whether the wound gets gradually better or worse is all up to the choices we make.” “You & Me” Tsai: “This song is a pure expression of emotion. One line in it, ‘My memories make mischief by bringing you before me, at every point measuring my misunderstanding of you,” tells of two people who get together despite knowing they’re incompatible. They think that proximity might be enough to wear away each other’s spikes and let them coexist comfortably. But the spikes grow back—they’re a natural part of them. Is it a good thing to be forever trying to change the purest form of our other half? Maybe we shouldn’t have been together in the first place. We did, though—and it’s a beautiful, painful process. For me, this song is incredibly meaningful.” “Broken Wings” Lin: “Pan used a Leslie speaker for the guitar on this one—we never used one before. It has an effect that makes the sound seem to sway in the air, so listening to it feels a little unreal. We found some wonderful surprises from the old equipment we came across while recording at Abbey Road Studios that further spurred our drive to make better music. “The percussion setup on this track is simple, a pairing of new drums and old ones. The old cymbals were pretty tarnished with a unique sound compared to newer cymbals. Recording that setup was a wonderful thing.” “Run, Run, Run!” Pan: “This is an especially important song for us and one that made us teary in the studio. It’s a song that breaks your heart every time. It sums up myself and my life since becoming part of Accusefive. I’m eager to share this feeling—and I hope this song can be there for any fan that needs it.”

To Dream, To Live, To Record
Accusefive IV On the Road
梦想成真不是音乐旅程终点，
而是要命傻瓜们狂奔的起点。
告五人第四张专辑《我们就像那些要命的傻瓜》
12 首关于成长试炼的问与答
人为何而飞？为何成长？给自己难题考验是否太傻？与怀疑共存不容易，但抛开安全感，或许才能真正地唤醒自己、疗愈自己。二〇二五年二月，告五人从世界巡回短暂抽身，即刻飞往伦敦传奇艾比路录音室（Abbey Road Studios），进行限期两周的录音计划。
街头寒风与外界纷扰，通通被艾比路的木色大门隔绝在外，“音乐”成为世界上最重要的事。在这距离家乡宜兰 9,819 公里远的传奇录音室里，他们为自己赋予了一道最要命的试炼题——首次担任自己的专辑制作人。
“过去一直有制作人在我们前面挡下很多事情，这次自己当专辑制作人，一直让我们思考，不安全感拉到最大的时候，我们三人需要做什么事情？”
抱着“总有一天必须自己完成一张专辑”的动机，告五人首度挂名专辑制作人，邀请实力坚强的伙伴组队启程。他们克服跨洋、跨语言、跨文化的录音阻碍，以不屈的意志捎给世界 12 首歌；聆听过程，仿佛也一起经历了乐团这两年来，挑战自我、重建自我的旅程，陪伴歌迷迎向一道道愈合之光。
抛开安全感的专业试炼：远行陌生异地 首度担任专辑制作人
从决定玩音乐的那一天起，告五人持续砥砺自己成为专业音乐人。专辑里的歌曲、制作都皆亲力亲为参与决定性讨论。即使身处忙碌的巡回路上，他们也随时都在构思新专辑；回宜兰家中放松仍不忘持续创作，用音乐纪录变化万千的每一刻情感念想。
登上大舞台后持续突破自我，告五人在第四张专辑首扛制作人大任，便决定飞往录出许多乐团名作的艾比路录音室、挑战国际级的制作环境。乐团三人几乎是不顾任何代价地，在前一年底幸运抢到录音档期后，连新年连假也不放了，和家人吃完年夜饭便整装出发、飞向冬季伦敦。
即使告五人已经有丰富的录音、巡演经验，抵达传奇录音室、看着走廊上的巨星音乐人照片，身心紧绷到头皮发麻，就连平常录音都很放松的云安都难掩紧张。在分秒必争的作业时间里，他们一边处理语言隔阂、时差与气候变化等现实压力，一边磨合“亚洲紧凑式 VS 英国chill式”的工作文化差异，不变的向导是心中最理想的那股声音。
实际录音状况确实不少，第一天进场就花了许多时间架设乐器、协调团队作业模式；过程中甚至一度遇到控台失灵、制作想法歧异的冲突，需要智慧与勇气化解。云安表示，过往累积的职业经验告诉他们，要抛开先入为主的观念，灵活应对各种难题，“看似顺利的时候也不能松懈，反而要用更严谨的心去面对。”
共同负起制作人的重责外，三人对自己原本的音乐角色也毫不懈怠。
云安宛如一台能量源源不绝的帮浦，供给团队士气与能量，除了唱歌还要弹吉他、钢琴，音乐性表现跨度极大。个性耿直的谦哥也总在前一晚练鼓到深夜，找寻最对的声音与力道，即使遇到困难也试图自我消化，不让团队担心。过往较少提出制作意见的犬青，不仅更勇于表达主见及想法，甚至在这张专辑碰上她演唱生涯难度的新高峰。
不只有巡回路途中拼命蓄积两年的创作，在伦敦密集的修行成长与试炼成果，也全都灌注到这张更加成熟的新专辑里。
金曲跨文化幕后阵容：深度合作日籍混音师渡辺省二郎 连五月天也来录音
与过往的制作模式相较，第四张专辑《我们就像那些要命的傻瓜》最大的不同是从车库录音回归正规录音室，并首度邀请到日籍混音师渡辺省二郎（Shojiro Watanabe）兼任录音师，打破“先录后混”的传统工序，同行飞往伦敦，在录音室里就先打造出“最到位”的声音。
告五人形容，渡辺老师是掌握四专声音方向的航海士。他曾多次参与《THE FIRST TAKE》节目录制，并与星野源、中岛美嘉合作；熟悉各种曲风的经典声响（vintage），并能开放地和全新的语言与年轻人的创意连结。
在伦敦，渡辺老师表达意见喜好都相当直接，以丰富的录音知识与美感，倾力协助他们运用艾比路录音室的器材、实践对味的类比美学，并将告五人独特的双主唱与鼓组频率紧紧交织。
除了渡辺老师，四专幕后亦邀集金曲级阵容，包括：陈君豪担任两首歌的共同制作人，柯智豪、黄中岳、徐平⋯⋯等，在前制期为不同类型的编曲展开情绪张力。
合作多年的配唱制作人韩立康也一同抵达伦敦，让云安与犬青能安稳甚至放肆地唱，在不同的歌里尝试吟喊、吆喝、歌剧般的共鸣或细若游丝的气音。甚至五月天的石头、玛莎也主动提议加入艾比路录音行列，和告五人首度合作，同在录音空间里演奏、录音、玩音乐。
“减法思考”的制作力：一场情绪饱满的摇滚狂奔之旅 追寻自己心中的声音
组成实力坚强的团队，在世界级水准的制作环境中，告五人拥有了创作上无限的加法可能，可在制作时却是“减法思考”，希望留下 demo 里的精华元素让音乐更精炼，声响情绪却依然饱满，铺开这一段由暗转明的黑夜狂奔之旅。
《我们就像那些要命的傻瓜》开场〈城市之丘〉取样枪林弹雨、螺旋桨声，匍匐曝出专辑主题句“我们就像那些要命的傻瓜”。警示的危机延续到〈有太多不能讲〉、〈将错就对〉里腹背受敌，也一步步止血化瘀，乍现早期〈丑人多作怪〉神韵。
影集《影后》序曲〈从未见过的海〉为专辑换景、翻页，柔软的篇章里，你可以陆续听见犬青独唱的抒情曲〈愈合〉，以及力邀“金曲制作人”柯智豪编曲的电子摇滚实验作〈依着光〉，疗愈你心底的废墟。
与五月天石头、玛莎合奏的“英伦 city pop”歌曲〈快乐的事记不起〉，引入“悲歌欢唱”的矛盾情绪，以拍手、欢呼、呐喊，期待这首歌能把稍纵即逝的快乐记起。揭示四专后半色调忽暗忽明，带你潜进告五人内心的微光独白。
由潘燕山填词的〈鹰〉提着鸟笼唱飞行，砥砺在变与不变间努力拍翅的自己；曾为电影主题曲的〈我天生 - 有梦版〉唱出“我就是有病才会喜欢你”，调皮却真情。
找来“大师级吉他”黄中岳编曲的〈夏天的海冬天的雪〉，让爱随着季节交替一刀两宽；衔接专辑收场曲〈黑夜狂奔〉，指着隧道尽头的光、唱出成长的伤痛，最后幡然领悟：“你是你自己的礼物，你自己的光。”
音乐是日常 他们是日记：把最傻的样子献给一起走到最后的人
告五人认为：“最傻的样子，要留给一起走到最后的人。”《我们就像那些要命的傻瓜》的 bonus track〈黑画面之旅〉，便是他们献给一路相伴的哈瓜歌迷的礼物。
这首从直播企划发展而生的短曲，放入专辑里依然充满画面感。仿佛卸下各种创作成绩的压力、回到爱音乐的本质，告五人私下赤诚、自然、傻气的模样，全都在那不过度修整、同步录音的合唱与合奏里。
尾声一整段长长的“声音实况”，将带你游览艾比路录音室的壮阔，以及与伙伴共同打造音乐，坦率甚至有点童趣的互动过程。或许面对告五人的音乐，便需要这样无需矫饰的形容与全然放松的心情，他们的感情完全就是他们写下的事情，一字不假。
音乐是日常，他们是日记，不断地唱只希望其中一句能进到你心里。回首这趟录音历程，告五人把不安全感开到最大，从国际级的标准环境里刺激进步、找出这个乐团独有的声音。《我们就像那些要命的傻瓜》便是他们绕了世界一圈，最后仍想对你坦白的事情，从海的另一边取来，用要命的傻抵御人间冷冽的歌。
告五人说，这是他们非常喜欢的一张专辑。制作过程再次感受、确认真正自己想做的事，不管会不会被说变了，这张专辑都会是他们引以为傲的羽毛，从一场飞行而来，又将带着自己起飞。在二〇二五年七月，献给愿意也做过相同选择，并为自己的决定持续前进，在实践梦想路上有点傻却仍充满爱的你。
专辑歌曲介绍：
01 城市之丘
杂乱的讯号是迟迟不降的螺旋桨，争执与冲突则是一声声枪响。云安形容，〈城市之丘〉是欲望隆起的意象，与之周旋的傻瓜试图用摇滚乐奋力抵抗。这首歌带有电玩感的歌曲，有告五人鲜少表露的战意，以我们每个人面对心中欲望对错时的天人交战，为四专带来烟硝弥漫的开场。
02 有太多不能讲
出了社会得学着读懂潜规则，游走于“不能讲”的危险感受有时也带点趣味。〈有太多不能讲〉是一首编曲特别戏剧化的歌，融合 shuffle 吉他、marching band 的行进大鼓、小鼓与手钹，以及云安歌剧般的唱声元素。从悄声压抑唱到歇斯底里，反差极大的编曲象征成长的坦途与不安。
03 将错就对
回忆一路汇集，过往的好与坏同时定义了现在的你。〈将错就对〉与金曲制作人陈君豪远端连线、共同制作。危机四伏的 moog 低音合成器，搭配斩断纠缠的钢琴，试图用史诗般的抒情摇滚面对命定论。云安透露，“我一直转”描写的是宜兰天上的繁星，在痛苦的回忆里，他们仍想把最美的部分留给你。
04 从未见过的海
历经专辑前三首“重型歌曲”，影集《影后》的话题序曲〈从未见过的海〉如翩翩微风，为专辑的画面翻页。它轻盈地放下遗憾，试图带你到彼岸重生、相遇，放在专辑的脉络听，仿佛预演着告五人远渡重洋，到英国异地录音、开拓视野的启程。
05 愈合
〈愈合〉可比作第一张专辑的〈红〉，由犬青独唱，像是要避开一地玻璃、对待愈合中的伤口般，小心翼翼地吟哦。在犬青的歌唱生涯里，〈愈合〉是最具挑战性的歌曲，极轻的歌反而在录音时极费力，她必须注意每一句话、每次呼吸，谨慎换气、避免唇齿杂音录到麦克风里。
06 依着光
有光的就有影，依着光的人同时也与黑暗同在。〈依着光〉由柯智豪编曲，带有科幻感的电子合成器音色，实现了云安创作时设想的超现实画面。他形容，那就像《霍尔的移动城堡》尾声，苏菲遇到年轻的霍尔，背后却是漫天星星坠落，奇异、美丽，却也悲伤。
07 快乐的事记不起
得来不易的幸福，值得写歌记住。在艾比路录音室第二周，五月天的石头、玛莎惊喜现身，和告五人一起玩音乐，透过〈快乐的事记不起〉实现两团合奏的梦幻画面。石头的吉他以简单的切分音缀饰，加上玛莎招牌的贝斯线条，和告五人一同打造独特的“英伦 city pop”曲风。
08 鹰
面对环境的意见与改变，也不能忘记身上的羽毛，才能让你起飞。〈鹰〉是告五人多年的压箱作，由潘燕山作词，以一只鹰的飞行隐喻受制于各种声音与意见，却仍想飞的心情。在艾比路录音室里，渡辺老师建议他们用 Leslie speaker 音箱录音，模拟鹰的盘旋画面，和经典的 TG12345 控台赋予了这首歌平稳且温暖的质地。
09 我天生 - 有梦版
由陈君豪制作〈我天生 - 有梦版〉，以游乐园般的梦幻编曲，中和了歌词的灰暗。潘云安形容，在告五人的专辑里总有一首荒谬的歌，忠实反映这个世界无所不在的荒谬。唱着“我天生有病”的〈我天生 - 有梦版〉就是那首荒谬却深情的歌。
10 夏天的海冬天的雪
从吉他泛音开场的〈夏天的海冬天的雪〉，由台湾首屈一指的吉他大师黄中岳编曲。透过电吉他与木吉他交织出爱的四季轮转，显影云安脑中“美梦终究不敌现实”的意象。此曲 MV 在英国拍摄，透过回旋轨道的镜头，述说一段爱与失去的故事。
11 黑夜狂奔
童话破灭，是为了在新的世界被重新发现。〈黑夜狂奔〉以经典的英式摇滚风格，献给每个狂奔的灵魂，在追逐梦中声音的路途上，不会忘记自己本来的模样。乍看晦暗的歌名，却有着最炙热的能量。
Bonus Track: 黑画面之旅
最傻的样子留给愿意听到最后的人。伦敦录音尾声，三人重聚同步合奏完成的〈黑画面之旅〉，仅以一把吉他与简单的打击伴奏，呈现最真实的告五人。若你戴上耳机听最后两分钟的对话，便能听见团员游走在艾比路录音室的阶梯上，私下天然呆、毫不保留的模样。

brief: On their fourth album, The Dreamers—whose Chinese name is the rather more indecent “We’re just like those damn fools”—indie-rock band Accusefive consider questions of maturity, direction and destiny. And to match the scope of those big ideas, the trio hit the road themselves, leaving Taiwan to record at London’s famed Abbey Road Studios. There, Tsai Hsin-lun (vocals), Pan Yun-an (vocals/guitar) and Richard Lin (drums) opted to break with their usual practice of treating recording and mixing as separate stages and capture as complete a sound as possible in the studio—while aiming to retain the core soul of their original demos. The result is a set of ambitious yet vulnerable tracks fuelled by the experience of the journey, from fruitful collaborations to the studio’s collection of historic equipment. Below, the members of Accusefive share with Apple Music how they rose to the challenge of realising the record they had in mind. How did recording in London and self-producing affect your creative process? Tsai Hsin-lun: “We saw different results. Cultural differences aside, different settings have their own rules. We weren’t in Asia; we were in an unfamiliar environment. Self-producing this album and integrating a place that wasn’t ours was a way for us to try something new. This will remain in our memories as a special chapter in our lives.” Lin: “I feel like it’s an important nutrient. Accusefive tries new things each and every year, so it’s a new experience not just for the three of us but for the entire team.” What’s your process for achieving the Accusefive sound? Tsai: “The best way to describe Accusative’s sound quality is ‘direct’. We like using a direct approach and directly expressing emotions in our demos, but our choice of words, arrangements and harmonies bring out different feelings. Working from these demos, we chose to use a subtractive process for our songs. This gives them all a broad sense of direction, but we’re actually very particular when we perform them to make sure all the emotional ingredients are under control. So the album is both direct and exacting.” Richard Lin: “Subtractive thinking means having a definite picture of the timbre in your mind. You need that picture to be very clear before you record. The thing that’s hard is how to express it. Everyone’s subtractive process is different, so we’re always trying out different things and talking about adjusting the details to mould the shape of the sound so that it goes in the direction we want. “We worked with Shojiro Watanabe as recording and mixing engineer, so our process this time was to decide on the direction of the sound first, before doing any recording. It was challenging for us because we hadn’t done anything like it before.” How would you characterise the album as a whole? Pan Yun-an: “Our fourth album is a summation of my personal experiences and my outlook on life. It has a little of the feeling of a tearful recollection. So many things have happened along the way—I thought for ages about whether I ought to write them into song. Of course, ultimately I did decide to—and to head forward along our chosen path. “To us, listening to an album involves lots and lots of layers—like waves in the ocean or the elevations while climbing a mountain—each with a different aesthetic. The layers we’ve chosen this time are more like waves.” “The opening three songs are on the heavier side. But by ‘Beyond The Sea’, it’s like turning a page to a different scene to plunge straight into the ocean depths, where you find ’Threads Of Me’. Then it’s an upward road through ‘Forget For Get’, ‘Happy Bomb!!’, ‘Broken Wings’, ‘True Colors - Dreamers’ and ‘You & Me’ to the high point of ‘Run, Run, Run!’. I love this track order, which make the album sound like wave upon wave.” Below, Accusefive share insights into selected album tracks “Run, Run, Run!” Pan: “This is an especially important song for us and one that made us teary in the studio. It’s a song that breaks your heart every time. It sums up myself and my life since becoming part of Accusefive. I’m eager to share this feeling—and I hope this song can be there for any fan that needs it.” “Turn Wrong To Right” Pan: “This song describes a fateful choice. My favourite lyrics are 'You and I had hardships in the past/But after all those ordeals we no longer beat ourselves up/Let wrongs be wrongs and love be love/Make the best of it and face the future no matter what comes.’ For me, that passage is an explanation of the entire album. We can choose to remember the happy things and forget the painful ones, to find ways to change and reflect instead of wallowing in pain. It’s a way to cheer myself up, and to say to my past self, ‘Hey, let’s try to make the loneliness go away.’” “Happy Bomb!!” Pan: “We had a great time working with Masa and Stone of Mayday. This one echoes the other tracks in saying that moments of happiness shouldn’t be forgotten—they ought to be remembered. I wrote this song with my older brother Pan Yanshan, who’s a lively and fascinating writer. He did the verses and I did the chorus.” “Threads Of Me” Pan: “This song was revised more than any other on the album. We held lots of meetings and even got into arguments while discussing the arrangement—all because it’s an important song. We were trying to decide what style to use to interpret it and what part it should play on the album. We ultimately found it a place as the album’s lightest yet most serious song. On first hearing, it’s a song of reconciliation, a feeling of a wound that’s healed. But that’s not actually the case. The song asks the question, ‘What should we do with a wound that will never heal?’ Whether the wound gets gradually better or worse is all up to the choices we make.” “You & Me” Tsai: “This song is a pure expression of emotion. One line in it, ‘My memories make mischief by bringing you before me, at every point measuring my misunderstanding of you,” tells of two people who get together despite knowing they’re incompatible. They think that proximity might be enough to wear away each other’s spikes and let them coexist comfortably. But the spikes grow back—they’re a natural part of them. Is it a good thing to be forever trying to change the purest form of our other half? Maybe we shouldn’t have been together in the first place. We did, though—and it’s a beautiful, painful process. For me, this song is incredibly meaningful.” “Broken Wings” Lin: “Pan used a Leslie speaker for the guitar on this one—we never used one before. It has an effect that makes the sound seem to sway in the air, so listening to it feels a little unreal. We found some wonderful surprises from the old equipment we came across while recording at Abbey Road Studios that further spurred our drive to make better music. “The percussion setup on this track is simple, a pairing of new drums and old ones. The old cymbals were pretty tarnished with a unique sound compared to newer cymbals. Recording that setup was a wonderful thing.”
display_title: 我們就像那些要命的傻瓜

title: So Tonight That I Might See
description: Imagine a jukebox in Route 66's loneliest roadhouse, and it might sound a lot like Mazzy Star’s second album. Tambourines roll at tumbleweed tempos, a lap steel gently weeps, and Hope Sandoval sings with the fluid grace of a waking dream. The title track is a psychedelic swirl of feedback and gentle murmurs, and “Mary of Silence” goes even deeper into Doors-inspired drone rock. On “Fade into You,” Sandoval’s weary voice falls across acoustic strumming like velvet curtains brushing an empty dance floor.

localized_title.text: So Tonight That I Might See
So Tonight That I Might See

localized_description.text: Imagine a jukebox in Route 66's loneliest roadhouse, and it might sound a lot like Mazzy Star’s second album. Tambourines roll at tumbleweed tempos, a lap steel gently weeps, and Hope Sandoval sings with the fluid grace of a waking dream. The title track is a psychedelic swirl of feedback and gentle murmurs, and “Mary of Silence” goes even deeper into Doors-inspired drone rock. On “Fade into You,” Sandoval’s weary voice falls across acoustic strumming like velvet curtains brushing an empty dance floor.

En 1994, le groupe de rock indé Mazzy Star connaît son plus gros succès avec « Fade into You », succès hypnotique qui ouvre également son deuxième album. Naviguant entre country, folk, blues et dream pop, « So Tonight That I Might See » combine la guitare solitaire et légèrement saturée de David Roback et le chant anesthésié de Hope Sandoval. Avec leurs refrains dépouillés perdus dans le brouillard, les Californiens ornent leur rock d’une aura psychédélique.

迷幻音乐在九十年代成为尚存后朋克的中坚力量.Mazzy Star便是其杰出代表之一. Mazzy Star更加喜欢阴柔凄美的迷幻味道.从他们的音乐中更容易发现像the Doors.the Velvet Underground的遗风.邋遢懒散的吉他悲痛哀怨的民谣曲风几乎弥漫了整个九十年代几乎成为此类音乐的一种标准.Mazzy Star事实上是吉他手David Roback主唱Hope Sandoval的私人乐队. David Roback在Opal乐队时听到了由Hope Sandoval演唱的一盒录音带[Going Home].Hope嗓音深深打动了他.在Opal乐队的最后一次巡演中.Hope成为了乐队的主唱.不久后.David Roback和Hope Sandoval组建了Mazzy Star.乐队组建初期音乐风格和路线即已经划定.所有的音乐理念的构建在第一张专辑中即都几乎全部完成.此后的两张专辑都是在此基础上再填加一些其它的音乐元素的再发展.但终究没有出离原来的路线，这不知是乐队的创造力不足还是风格的限制或者其它什么原因.其实这也是大多数非主流乐队的最终归宿.在人员组合结构所决定的才华一次性燃尽后.难以为继.最终以解散告终.
